title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
While pasta cooks, heat a large pan over medium heat and cook pancetta until crispy.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, grated cheeses, and plenty of black pepper.
Reserve 1 cup of pasta water before draining the spaghetti.
Add hot spaghetti to the pancetta pan, remove from heat.
Quickly pour egg mixture over pasta, tossing continuously to create a creamy sauce.
Add pasta water as needed to reach desired consistency.
Serve immediately with extra cheese and black pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt and 1 tbsp tikka masala paste for 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a large pan and cook chicken until browned. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, saut√© onions until golden brown.
Add garlic and ginger, cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add remaining tikka masala paste and canned tomatoes, simmer for 10 minutes.
Blend the sauce until smooth using an immersion blender.
Return chicken to the pan and simmer for 10 minutes.
Stir in cream and garam masala, heat through.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with rice or naan.

title: Vegetable Stir Fry
summary: Fresh vegetables quickly cooked in a wok with soy sauce and ginger for a healthy meal.
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (bell peppers, broccoli, carrots, snow peas)
instructions: Prepare all vegetables by washing and cutting into uniform pieces.
Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large pan over high heat.
Add garlic and ginger, stir for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add harder vegetables first (carrots, broccoli), stir fry for 2 minutes.
Add remaining vegetables and stir fry for 3-4 minutes until crisp-tender.
In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, sesame oil, rice vinegar, and honey.
Pour sauce over vegetables and toss to coat evenly.
Cook for 1 more minute until sauce thickens slightly.
Garnish with sesame seeds and spring onions before serving.
